title: MVD to rein in practice of clicking photos of moving vehicles and imposing fines
content: MVD officials can intercept a vehicle and inspect the documents either physically or electronically as per provisions of Section 167A (3) of the Central Motor Vehicles Act

title: PM Modi to visit Saudi Arabia next week
content: The visit will provide an opportunity to build on the already strong strategic partnership between the two countries, said Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri

title: KSEB clears ₹78-crore project to replace overhead power lines with underground cables on major roads in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The project will primarily cover the stretch from Attakulangara Junction to Kowdiar Junction along the M.G. Road.

title: Congress asks Modi government to ‘strongly take up targeted violence against Hindus in Bangladesh’
content: According to the government’s reply in Parliament, there had been 76 attacks on Hindus in the previous two months, leading to the deaths of 23 Hindus, noted Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Construction of new health centres gathers pace
content: The patronage of UPHCs has increased in recent years and the need for more centres was felt during the COVID-19 pandemic when the demand for public health facilities increased

title: Erakudi police outpost building in ruins and has become a haven for criminal elements
content: Staff shortage and lack of sanction were key hurdle; a recommendation has been made to upgrade it into a police station considering its strategic location

title: Parts of Telangana forecast to receive rain on Sunday; 41°C - 44°C may be recorded in 13 northern districts
content: The highest temperature on Friday was 42.6°C in Nizamabad, followed by 41.3°C in Adilabad and 40.2°C in Medak

title: BRS decides to boycott Hyderabad LAC MLC election
content: Working president KTR asks party ranks to gather for silver jubilee meet at Elkathurthi on April 27 in large numbers

title: Hindi in NEP row: Undermining Marathi will not be tolerated, says Supriya Sule
content: NCP(SP) leader Supriya Sule opposes NEP 2020 in Maharashtra, emphasising the importance of Marathi language and education infrastructure

title: Karni Sena activist arrested in Aligarh for objectionable remarks against Akhilesh Yadav
content: Mohan Chauhan’s remarks were circulating on social media, on Friday (April 18, 2025) night from his residence under the Jawan police station limits in view of the “threat” to peace posed by his “inflammatory” comments

title: Telangana CM Revanth asks whether Hyderabad should end up like New Delhi; highlights need for Musi river rejuvenation
content: He invited Telugus in Japan to share ideas and also invest to realise the dream of making Telangana the symbol of development

title: CM Stalin launches ‘Kalaignar Kaivinai Thittam’ as T.N.’s alternative to PM Vishwakarma scheme
content: “We strongly opposed the Vishwakarma scheme, stating it would strengthen caste-based vocation,” Mr. Stalin said, adding that the scheme is a reflection of the fact that some still hold regressive ideas

title: Unseasonal rains accompanied by gusty winds and rains affect mango crop in Wadagera taluk of Karnataka
content: Mango growers were expecting a good yield and were about to pluck the fruit, but gusty winds, hailstorm and rain caused mangoes to drop from the trees

title: Government proposes 8 acre land for Police housing in Amaravati: Minister for Home
content: The police infrastructure would be strengthened in the region in view of the security requirement of the State Capital, the Minister said

title: India's first prototype fast-breeder reactor to be commissioned by September 2026
content: he commissioning of the Prototype Fast Breeder Reactor (PFBR) will mark the second stage of India's three-stage nuclear programme that aims to recycle spent fuel to reduce the inventory of radioactive waste

title: Supreme Court to hear on April 23 plea for grant of uniform compensation to victims of hate crime
content: The petition flagged the alleged "whimsical, discriminatory and arbitrary approach" adopted by the states in the grant of ex-gratia to the victims of hate crime and mob lynching and the "meagre" compensation provided to them.

title: NCW team meets riot-affected people in Betbona, Dhulian in Bengal's Murshidabad
content: The affected women narrated their plight during the violent days and demanded that permanent BSF camps be set up in select areas of the district and an NIA probe into the recent communal clashes, which claimed three lives

title: Nails pulled out, given electric shocks: Two workers tortured by employer on suspicion of theft in Chhattisgarh

title: 22 families shifted amid lurking threat of landslide in J-K's Kishtwar
content: Traffic remained suspended on the Kishtwar-Paddar road, connecting the famous Machail Mata shrine for the third day

title: Minister promises development of Banganapalle town in Nandyal  district of A.P.
content: The Minister asked officials to chalk out plans to develop junctions to ease traffic congestionin the town

title: Mumbai airport will remain shut for six hours on May 8
content: During this period both the primary runway (09/27) and secondary runway (14/32) will be temporarily non-operational, it said.

title: Centre’s excise duty hike on fuel is ‘tax terrorism’: Selvaperunthagai
content: In a statement, the Congress leader said when the UPA government stepped down, the excise duty on petrol and diesel was ₹9.20 and ₹3.46, respectively

title: Protests by Bengal’s teachers continue across the State despite Supreme Court relief
content: Representatives of the Deserving Teachers’ Rights Forum have said they will not call off their agitation till the West Bengal School Service Commission publishes the segregated list of tainted and untainted candidates

title: Only 89 primary and one final appeal filed to contest electoral rolls nationwide

title: Systematic persecution of Hindu minorities in Bangladesh under interim government: India

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko arrested under NDPS Act

title: Chennai gets its first air-conditioned EMU train service
content: The modern AC EMU rake is equipped with better facilities for passengers, including automatic doors, passenger information systems, CCTV cameras, and well-marked entry/exit points

title: Kushagra Gupta from Karnataka achieves 100 percentile score in JEE-2025 (main) Session-2
content: National Testing Agency (NTA) announced the result of JEE (Main)-2025, session-2 of Paper 1 for professional courses like BE/B.Tech in premier technical institutions like Indian Institute Technologies (IITs) on April 18

title: Why can’t courts issue directions to the President, asks former Supreme Court judge Jasti Chelameswar
content: If courts can declare a law made by Parliament unconstitutional, they can also issue directions to a public office holder to perform a public act, he says

title: NDA wins no-confidence motion against Mayor Hari Venkata Kumari
content: Anakapalli MP C.M. Ramesh has announced that as many as 74 corporators and ex-officio members have voted against Mayor in the no-confidence trust meeting, leading to unanimous victory of the NDA

title: Durai Vaiko resigns as principal secretary of MDMK
content: The leader said he would not like to continue in the post “when a person, who could not stomach my elevation in the party, derived pleasure in creating a bad name for the party and its leadership in the last four years.”

title: U.S. visa revocation not targeting Indians, says U.S. after survey found 50% of students facing notices were from India
content: Controversy brews ahead of U.S. V-P Vance’s visit; MEA tight-lipped about whether the student visa termination issue will be raised

title: A total of 25 Indian tourists injured in Nepal accident; three critical
content: Police from Nepal's Gadhawa reached the spot and admitted the injured to a local health centre from where 19 people were brought to Tulsipur in Uttar Pradesh

title: Four injured in temple fireworks accident in Kerala’s Palakkad
content: Accident took place during fireworks display organised as part of annual Vishu Vela celebrations at Perumkulangara temple on Friday night

title: Pawan Kalyan to receive land dispute related petitions during district tour
content: In a teleconference with the official, Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan took a serious note of land grabbing and told them to focus on curbing the menace so that private properties could be protected.

title: Kerala Opposition Leader says drug enforcers should ‘net big fish instead of targeting hapless addicts’
content: Satheesan says LDF government’s ‘much-hyped’ anti-narcotics enforcement drive has ‘missed the forest for the trees’

title: Crane collapses at construction site in Abids, no casualties

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko appears before Kochi City police for questioning in hotel drug raid incident
content: Police have reportedly prepared a detailed questionnaire of 30-odd questions, including why Shine Tom Chacko fled a hotel in Kochi upon seeing the police team on Wednesday night

title: School teacher suspended after video of him offering alcohol to students goes viral in Madhya Pradesh
content: Taking cognisance of the video, district collector Dilip Kumar Yadav directed the district education officer OP Singh to take action against the teacher, the official said.

title: Tamil Nadu’s installed power capacity increases by 3,000 MW this year
content: Total capacity stands at 42,772 MW against last year’s 39,806 MW; State expects to have multiple power projects up and running by year-end

title: Fire breaks out in Prayagraj tent supplier warehouse
content: He added water tenders were rushed to the spot and efforts were underway to bring the blaze under control

title: Glorifying Islamic rulers is an insult to Indian Muslims: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: West Bengal Governor Bose meets family of deceased in riot-hit Murshidabad
content: Before starting his journey to Shamsherganj, Mr. Bose will speak to some members of the affected families at the guest house in Farakka where he has been staying since Friday night, the official said

title: JEE (Main) result 2025: 24 candidates secure 100 NTA score; 110 cases of unfair means detected

title: Med City proposed in 50 acres of land near airport in Rajamahendravaram
content: IMA is expected to submit a feasibility report soon; plans are afoot to shift around 250 hospitals and clinics out of the city to the new facility

title: Mumbai police nab dentist from Kolkata for trafficking; rescue two children

title: Old techniques revived to restore Srikalahasti temple’s grandeur
content: A unique restoration effort that blends age-old techniques with new analytics promises a lasting solution to Srikalahasti temple’s persistent roof leaks and, in the process, offers a vista into how renovation of ancient structures without factoring in their construction styles can lead to more harm

title: Tension in Kuppam town as rowdy-sheeter ‘murders’ 63-year-old mechanic

title: Political parties continue to spar over cow deaths at TTD dairy farm

title: Anantapur and Sathya Sai districts will become a hub of solar energy, say Ministers

title: Youth electrocuted at mango orchard in Shamshabad
content: According to the police, Chetan Reddy entered the orchard and inadvertently came into contact with an exposed transformer wire situated near the compound wall

title: Eight cheetahs to be brought to India from Botswana; first four to arrive in May
content: Forest officials informed that there are 26 cheetahs at Kuno National Park, including 16 in the open forest and 10 in the rehabilitation centre (enclosures)

title: Pakistan Navy's plan to hold naval exercise off Trincomalee scrapped following India's concerns
content: The Pakistani Navy operates in close cooperation with China's PLA Navy and New Delhi has reasons to have concerns over any visit by Pakistani warships to Trincomalee

title: 11 dead, 11 injured in Delhi’s Mustafabad building collapses
content: Tragic building collapse in Delhi’s Mustafabad leaves 11 dead, several trapped; rescue efforts underway by multiple agencies

title: AP-Transco executing 55 transmission projects worth ₹4,965 crore, says Chief Secretary
content: The AP-Transco is in the process of integrating advanced technologies to improve real-time monitoring, efficiency and minimise energy losses, says Vijayanand

title: U.K. top court’s definition of woman further polarises debate on gender
content: The court unanimously ruled that only biological women meet the legal definition of a woman; the judges counselled against reading the judgment as a triumph for one or more groups at the expense of another; trans supporters, however, worry that the ruling is a setback for trans inclusion

title: Elaborate arrangements being made for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Andhra Pradesh on May 2
content: The Prime Minister is scheduled to kick off the capital construction works in Amaravati; government constitutes organising committee with six Ministers to look after the arrangements

title: Vice-President’s remarks on judiciary unacceptable, says CPI leader

title: In Bengal’s Murshidabad, scars from a communal fire
content: On April 11 and 12, protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, in Murshidabad district turned violent, leaving three people dead and hundreds homeless. Moyurie Som reports on the survivors and the communal fault lines that are deepening across West Bengal

title: Not allowed to attend Friday prayers, bid to pressurise me: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: The ruling National Conference (NC) took exception to the move to bar the Mirwaiz from attending Friday prayers

title: NBA Rank, playoffs edition: The 50 most impactful players for 2025

title: Ja braves 'difficult' injury, leads Grizz into playoffs
content: Ja Morant acknowledged his sprained right ankle was "more difficult than others" but scored 22 points to lead the Grizzlies past the Mavericks 120-106 to secure the No. 8 seed in the Western Conference playoffs.

title: Mavs proud as 'tumultuous' year ends in play-in

title: 'It's just sad': Luka weighs in on Harrison's talk

title: Marathi Compulsory In Maharashtra, Learning Other Languages A Choice: D Fadnavis
content: After Maharashtra government made Hindi compulsory as a third language under NEP 2020, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis asserted that while Marathi is non-negotiable and must be learned by all, learning additional languages remains a personal choice.

title: Malayalam Actor Shine Tom Chacko Arrested For 'Drug Use', Gets Bail
content: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko, who fled from a hotel in Kochi during a narcotics raid earlier this week, was arrested by Kochi police on Saturday after about a four-hour long interrogation in connection with a drug case. He got bail hours later.

title: "Sad That After My Death...": UP Man Dies By Suicide, Blames Wife In Letter
content: A 34-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad in a suicide bid consumed poison and died two days later at a local hospital during treatment.

title: Court Allows Baba Siddique's Wife To Intervene In Murder Case Proceedings
content: A special court on Saturday allowed Shehzeen Siddique, the wife of former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique, who was shot dead in October last year, to intervene in the proceedings of his murder case.

title: "Scared To Be Out": How Foreign Students Navigate US Visa Revocation Anxiety
content: Foreign students living in the US constantly see agents in plain clothes out of the blue and taking students to detention centres, on social media and that is causing a lot of anxiety for them.

title: "Proactive Action Will be Taken": Bengal Governor Meets Murshidabad Riot Victims
content: West Bengal Governor C V Ananda Bose on Saturday met family members of a man and his son, who were killed during violence over anti-Waqf Act protests in Murshidabad district, and assured them of all possible support, a senior official said.

title: Naveen Patnaik Becomes BJD President For 9th Time In A Row

title: 'No Right To Appeal For Kulbhushan Jadhav Because...': Pak Supreme Court Told

title: Drunk Man Beats Wife, Bites Off Her Finger In Noida: Cops

title: CCTV Captures Moment When Building Collapsed In Delhi's Mustafabad

title: Can Cannabis Help Treat Cancer? What Largest-Ever Study Reveals

content: the lakers had defeated the Knicks 128-112 behind a stout defensive effort . a box score offered clues at how they'd done it . the next game, 122-97 win over the Clippers, offered more evidence .

content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: MLS, Saudi Arabia or another club in Europe: What's next for Kevin de Bruyne?
content: new signing Kevin De Bruyne is looking for a new club after news broke in early April that city would not be offering him a contract at the end of the 2024-25 season . there's heavy interest from within Major League Soccer as reports emerged last week that inter Miami acquired de Brune's MLS discovery rights . the Saudi Pro League is also reportedly interested, but it's far from a guarantee .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs first-round guide: Best bets and Conn Smythe predictions
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs begin on saturday with 16 teams looking to etch their name onto Lord Stanley's Cup . the Winnipeg Jets look to make their first Stanley Cup Final appearance . they will face the los Angeles Kings for the fourth straight postseason .

title: Messi: No comparison between Argentina, Mexico
content: argentina's Lionel Messi has doubled down on his recent feud with fans . the clashes between the Albiceleste and El Tri have become a world cup classic . last one was in the first round of Qatar 2022, with a 2-0 victory for the team .

title: Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers, Mets or Padres No. 1 this week?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers have fallen from the top spot thanks to a recent rough patch . the New york Mets, San Diego Padres or San Francisco Giants replaced the defending champions atop our week 3 Power Rankings .

title: Playoff picks: Every first-round series, plus Cup champion, Conn Smythe Trophy
content: the 2024-25 NHL season is officially in the rearview mirror . sixteen of the league's teams have made the postseason bracket . 16 have been eliminated . the player who will win the Conn Smythe Trophy (playoff MVP)

title: 800 footages, 50 hospital staff: How police caught man for raping flight attendant
content: A Medanta Hospital ICU technician, Deepak (25), has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a flight attendant on ventilator support. The victim, based in West Bengal, reported the incident after being discharged. Police identified Deepak through CCTV footage and staff statements. Medanta has suspended the technician and is cooperating with the investigation.

title: Troops get 4G/5G connectivity at high-altitude posts in Ladakh
content: In a significant stride, the Indian Army has facilitated 4G and 5G mobile connectivity in Ladakh's high-altitude regions, benefiting troops and civilians alike. This initiative, a collaborative effort, extends to forward locations like Galwan and Siachen, boosting morale and enabling socio-economic development in remote border villages by integrating them into the national digital network.

title: Supreme Court responsible for inciting religious wars in the country: BJP
content: Following Vice President Dhankhar's criticism, BJP leader Nishikant Dubey has escalated the conflict with the Supreme Court, suggesting Parliament should shut down if the court makes laws. Dubey accused the Supreme Court of inciting religious wars and exceeding its authority, particularly regarding Article 377 and the Waqf Act, sparking debate over the judiciary's role.

title: Drama at Narendra Modi Stadium! Spat breaks out - Watch
content: A heated exchange between Ishant Sharma and Ashutosh Sharma ignited the Gujarat Titans-Delhi Capitals IPL 2025 match. The verbal spat occurred after a contentious bouncer, leading to arguments involving Shubman Gill and the umpires. Despite the tension, Delhi Capitals posted a competitive 203/8, fueled by Ashutosh's explosive cameo of 37 runs.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Ross Gerber, a Tesla investor, has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted away from the electric car company, particularly towards X AI. Gerber believes Musk's involvement with controversial figures like Donald Trump has negatively impacted Tesla's reputation.

title: Delhi building collapse: Toll mounts to 11, several feared trapped
content: A building collapsed in Mustafabad, Delhi early Saturday. Rescue operations are underway. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. NDRF and Delhi Police teams are at the site. The collapse follows recent heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in Delhi. Last week, a wall collapse near Madhu Vihar resulted in one death and two injuries.

title: Nayar joins SRK co-owned IPL franchise; BCCI yet to confirm departure
content: Abhishek Nayar has rejoined the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) amidst the ongoing IPL season, shortly after his departure from the Indian cricket team's coaching staff. KKR announced Nayar's arrival through a social media post, even before an official statement from the BCCI.

title: Shark Tank judge Aman Gupta on Blu Smart fraud: Bachpan mein parents ne...
content: Aman Gupta addressed the BluSmart fraud, highlighting the importance of ethics and governance. He emphasized that financial mismanagement damaged trust in the startup ecosystem, causing losses for investors, founders, employees, and customers. Gupta urged entrepreneurs to prioritize clean financial records and transparent reporting over rapid growth, advocating for ethical business practices.

title: Texas man accused of butchering father claims aliens took his organs
content: Jaime Adrian Contreras, 39, has been arrested in El Paso, Texas, for the gruesome murder of his 74-year-old father, Victor Gerardo Contreras. The victim was found disemboweled with multiple stab wounds in their shared home.

title: 'Was shocked when I lifted veil': Man tricked into marrying would-be wife's mother
content: Mohammad Azim from Meerut was deceived during his nikah ceremony in Shamli. Instead of marrying the expected 21-year-old Mantasha, he discovered the bride was her 45-year-old mother, Tahira. Azim alleges his brother and sister-in-law orchestrated the switch and threatened him with a false rape case when he protested.

title: How Florida students used chewing gum to escape campus shooting
content: A deadly mass shooting at Florida State University left two dead and five wounded. Student Jeffrey LaFray recounted using chewing gum to stick paper over windows for safety. The shooter, Phoenix Ikner, was shot by police and hospitalized. Victims included Aramark employees Tiru Chabba and Robert Morales. Another student, Madison Askins, survived by playing dead.

title: Lauren Sánchez gets $7,000 designer bag from Kardashians after Blue Origin flight
content: Following Lauren Sánchez's Blue Origin space flight, Kris Jenner, Kim, and Khloé Kardashian gifted her a $6,995 Judith Leiber UFO handbag. The Kardashians supported Sánchez in Texas, praising the historic all-female mission. Sánchez also addressed the need for better-fitting spacesuits for women, collaborating with designers to create a suit specifically designed for women.

title: NBA playoffs bracket
content: Content extraction failed.

title: Family of Indian student shot in Canada seeks Centre's help to get body back
content: The family of Harsimrat Kaur Randhawa, a 21-year-old Indian student fatally struck by a stray bullet in Hamilton, Canada, is seeking assistance from the Indian government to repatriate her body. Randhawa, a Mohawk College student, was waiting at a bus stop when she was hit during a shooting incident involving two vehicles.

title: IPL: Nayar set to re-join KKR, but shouldn't there be a cooling-off period?
content: Abhishek Nayar's potential sudden shift from India's assistant coach to the Kolkata Knight Riders mid-season raises eyebrows, especially concerning potential conflicts of interest. His inside knowledge of Team India players like Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj could give KKR a tactical advantage in the on-going IPL 2025.

title: 'I've put an end to all fights': Uddhav's alliance offer for Raj Thackeray
content: Uddhav Thackeray, Shiv Sena (UBT) chief, signalled a potential reunion with cousin Raj Thackeray. This comes before the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation election. Thackeray expressed readiness to unite for Maharashtra's benefit. He emphasised prioritising the state's interests. The move occurs amidst challenges for the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance. The Thackeray cousins have a complex political history.

title: SBI PO Mains admit card released: Download your hall ticket
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has released the admit cards for the SBI PO Mains 2025 exam, scheduled for May 5. Eligible candidates can download their call letters from the official website, www.sbi.co.in, using their registration number and date of birth. The admit card includes essential exam details and instructions. Candidates are advised to verify all information and prepare thoroughly for this crucial stage of the SBI PO recruitment process, which leads to group exercises and interviews.

title: Congress leader killed as BJP worker rams motorcycle in Chhattisgarh
content: In Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon district, a local Congress leader was killed, and his sister-in-law injured, after a BJP worker allegedly rammed his car into their motorcycle. The incident occurred near Dogri Guda village, and the accused, Purendra Kaushik, has been taken into custody. Bhoyar's family alleges the attack was driven by political rivalry following recent panchayat elections.

title: 'Sorry but this is fake news': Preity Zinta refutes quote about Rishabh Pant
content: Bollywood actress Preity Zinta has refuted a viral social media claim attributing a disparaging remark about cricketer Rishabh Pant to her. The rumour suggested Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, criticised Pant after the IPL auction, implying the team preferred Shreyas Iyer. Zinta swiftly dismissed the quote as "fake news" on X.

title: 'Smiling meet between PM Modi, Yunus failed': Congress on murder of Hindu leader
content: The Congress party has strongly condemned the murder of Hindu leader Bhavesh Chandra Roy in Bangladesh, questioning the effectiveness of recent diplomatic engagements. Mallikarjun Kharge cited numerous attacks on Hindus and other minorities, criticizing the interim government's failure to protect them.

title: 'Honour to speak with PM Modi': Musk says 'looking forward to India visit later this year'
content: Tech mogul Elon Musk has announced his plans to visit India later this year, responding to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's post on X. Musk expressed honor in speaking with PM Modi and eagerness to explore collaboration opportunities.

title: HDFC bank registers 6.7% rise in Q4 profit, reaches Rs 17600 cr
content: HDFC Bank reported a 6.6% increase in standalone net profit for Q4 FY25, reaching Rs 17,616 crore. Total income remained nearly flat at Rs 89,488 crore, while interest income rose to Rs 77,460 crore. The board recommended a dividend of Rs 22 per share. Asset quality slightly deteriorated, with gross NPAs rising to 1.33%.

title: How can chia seed water reduce belly fat?
content: Chia seed water is gaining traction as a weight management tool, particularly for reducing belly fat. Rich in fiber, protein, and omega-3 fatty acids, these seeds promote fullness, regulate blood sugar, and combat inflammation. Incorporating chia seed water into a balanced diet and exercise routine can support weight loss goals by improving digestion and providing sustained energy.

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko arrested by Kerala Police in drug case
content: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko was apprehended by Kerala Police on Saturday concerning alleged drug use, following his appearance at the Ernakulam North Police Station with his legal representatives. He was questioned about his reported attempt to evade authorities during a recent hotel search, where he allegedly fled after realizing police presence. Actress Vincy Aloshious had previously accused Shine of inappropriate conduct under the influence, filing complaints with the Film Chamber and AMMA.

title: Shubman Gill gives massive update on Kagiso Rabada
content: Shubman Gill, Gujarat Titans' captain, chose to bowl first against Delhi Capitals in their IPL match at Ahmedabad, citing the hot weather and favorable wicket conditions. Titans maintained an unchanged lineup, with Gill anticipating Kagiso Rabada's return in approximately ten days. Delhi Capitals, led by Axar Patel, decided to bench Jake Fraser-McGurk.

title: Plane loses wheel, catches fire in Puerto Rico; passengers thought 'it was the end’
content: A Frontier Airlines flight experienced a harrowing landing in San Juan after the front landing gear failed. The Airbus A321, carrying 228 passengers, made a hard initial landing, causing a wheel to break off. The pilots regained control, circled the airport, and safely landed the plane with no injuries reported, prompting an FAA and NTSB investigation.

title: 'They want sense of security': WB governor meets victims of Murshidabad violence
content: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose continued his visits to violence-affected areas, meeting victims in Murshidabad a day after visiting a relief camp in Malda. He listened to their grievances and assessed their needs. Simultaneously, a National Commission for Women delegation, led by Chairperson Vijaya Rahatkar, surveyed the Murshidabad areas, describing the suffering as inhuman. The NCW will submit a report to the Centre, highlighting the people's demands, and met with the family of victims allegedly killed during the protests.

title: Employers torture teens with 'electric shocks' in Chhattisgarh
content: Two teenage cousins from Rajasthan's Bhilwara were allegedly tortured by their employers at an ice-cream shop in Chhattisgarh's Korba after requesting an advance payment. The victims claim they were beaten, given electric shocks, and had their nails pulled. An FIR has been registered, and police are investigating the allegations, while the employers accuse the cousins of theft.

title: Minor refuses to chant ‘Jai Sri Ram’, thigh pierced with glass piece in Kanpur
content: In Kanpur's Sarsaul area, a 13-14 year old Muslim boy was attacked by a group of minors for refusing to chant 'Jai Sri Ram'. The assailants intercepted him, demanding he bow down and comply with their religious demands. Upon his refusal, they assaulted him, piercing his thigh with broken glass, leading to a police complaint and ongoing investigation.

title: 'Kung Fu Pandya': MI celebrate 'Clutch God' Hardik Pandya’s IPL journey
content: Mumbai Indians celebrated Hardik Pandya's decade in the IPL, highlighting his journey from a promising player to a key all-rounder. After a successful stint with MI, Pandya led Gujarat Titans to a title before returning to Mumbai as captain in 2024. Despite a challenging start, MI has shown resilience, and Pandya's contributions across 143 IPL matches solidify his impact.

title: ‘Speechless after hearing their pain’: NCW chief meets Murshidabad violence victims
content: Following communal clashes in Murshidabad linked to protests over the Waqf (Amendment) Act, the National Commission for Women (NCW), led by Chairperson Vijaya Rahatkar, and West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose visited the violence-affected areas.

title: 'Veteran cricketer asked to sleep with me': Anaya's bold confession
content: Anaya Bangar, daughter of Sanjay Bangar, revealed facing harassment within the cricket world after her gender-affirming surgery. She received nude photos from cricketers and faced verbal abuse, including a proposition from a former player. Anaya has represented Islam Gymkhana in Mumbai’s club circuit and also played for Hinckley Cricket Club in Leicestershire, UK.

title: Half of student visas revoked by US are of Indians: Report
content: The US faces scrutiny for its increasing visa revocations and SEVIS terminations targeting international students, disproportionately affecting Indians. AILA reports 50% of such cases involve Indian students, raising concerns about arbitrary actions. Despite a surge in Indian students pursuing US education, anecdotal evidence suggests a decline in aspirations.

title: RBI’s gold reserves jump nearly Rs 12,000 crore in a week
content: India's central bank witnessed a significant surge in its gold reserves' value, driven by a global rally in gold prices amidst geopolitical and economic uncertainties. The RBI's gold holdings nearly tripled in value over the past year, reflecting a broader trend of central banks worldwide accumulating gold to hedge against global risks.

title: Tim David to RCB management: 'If I get chance to bat up ... '
content: Despite Royal Challengers Bengaluru's defeat, Tim David earned Player of the Match for his explosive half-century against Punjab Kings in a rain-shortened match. David expressed his willingness to bat higher in the order and highlighted the challenging conditions and the team's struggles at home.

title: An ingredient in common cooking oil linked to aggressive breast cancer
content: A recent study reveals a potential link between linoleic acid, an omega-6 fatty acid abundant in cooking oils and animal products, and the growth of aggressive triple-negative breast cancer. Researchers found that linoleic acid activates a major cancer growth pathway by binding to FABP5, leading to increased tumor growth.

title: Flight attendant 'digitally raped' at Gurgaon hospital: What does it mean?
content: A technician at Medanta Hospital in New Delhi has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a flight attendant who was on a ventilator in the ICU. The accused, identified as Deepak, reportedly committed digital rape while nurses were present. Police identified him after reviewing CCTV footage and questioning over 50 hospital employees, leading to his confession.

title: IPL 2025, GT vs DC: Team prediction, head-to-head, pitch report, weather update
content: Delhi Capitals (DC) will clash with Gujarat Titans (GT) in Ahmedabad. DC, boosted by a Super Over win, relies on Mitchell Starc's pace against GT's strong top order of Gill, Sudharsan, and Buttler. Mohammed Siraj's form is crucial against DC's openers, while spinners like Rashid Khan and Kuldeep Yadav could dominate on the dry pitch.

title: Mumbai airport will remain shut for 6 hours on May 9
content: Mumbai Airport will suspend flight operations for six hours on May 9. This is for pre-monsoon runway maintenance. Both runways will be closed from 11 am to 5 pm. The annual maintenance ensures the airport's airside facilities are in good condition. Technical experts will assess runway surfaces. They will also implement solutions for water accumulation.

title: 'Goes to Maldives mid-season': KL Rahul roasts 'mentor' Pietersen - Watch
content: Before their IPL match, KL Rahul playfully teased Delhi Capitals mentor Kevin Pietersen about the role of a mentor, joking about mid-season Maldives trips. This lighthearted moment went viral, overshadowing the anticipation for the game where Delhi Capitals aimed to maintain their top position against Gujarat Titans, who were eager to disrupt their winning streak.
